# Projects and publications
&nbsp;

<div align="justify">
### Alongside the publications from my PhD work, I've also been working on a few Open Scholarship projects:
&nbsp;


  * Open Scholarship in the Developing World project, in collaboration with FORRT. More information coming soon! 
  * Creating a translated and adapted for Bulgarian version of <a href="https://forrt.org/glossary/" target="_blank">FORRT's Glossary</a> (work in progress)
  * Participated as a community reviewer of <a href="https://science.nasa.gov/open-science/transform-to-open-science" target="_blank">NASA's Transform to Open Science curriculum</a>
  * Investigating the impact of open and reproducible scholarship on students’ attitudes, outcomes, and engagement, as part of <a href="https://forrt.org/impact/" target="_blank">FORRT</a> (see <a href="https://doi.org/10.1098/rsos.221255" target="_blank">Pownall et al., 2023</a>)
  * Working on a project about the <a href="https://osf.io/f5zhj/" target="_blank">feminist ways of doing science</a> (<a href="https://doi.org/10.31219/osf.io/2rcuz" target="_blank">Hartmann et al., 2023</a>)
  * Team leader of the University of Birmingham Team and analyst in <a href="https://many-speech-analyses.github.io/" target="_blank">Many Speech Analyses collaborative project </a>aiming to understand the robustness of speech analyses (see <a href="https://doi.org/10.1177/25152459231162567" target="_blank">Coretta et al., 2023</a>)
  * Contributing to the<a href="https://forrt.org/reversals/" target="_blank"> Replications and Reversals FORRT project</a>, where we're developing a very large resource of the replicability of effects across the social and natural sciences (manuscript in prep)
  * Taking part in <a href="https://forrt.org/summaries/" target="_blank">FORRT's 100+ Summaries of Open and Reproducible Science Literature project</a>, which is planned to be a very large resource for Open Scholarship educators and people who want to learn more about doing better science (manuscript in prep)
  * Working on a project investigating best practices for publishing student graduate work (manuscript in prep). More information coming soon!
  * Part of an international team <a href="https://osf.io/d6pu5/" target="_blank">investigating the adoption of Open Science practices cross-culturally</a> (see <a href="https://dx.doi.org/10.4135/9781529602074" target="_blank">Baum et al., 2022</a>)
  * Contributed to the Bulgarian translation of the <a href="https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-019-0772-6" target="_blank">Consensus-Based Transparancy Checklist </a>(see Balazs et al., 2020, for the original English version)
&nbsp;
